archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
name: Iberian Herb-Crusted Roast Leg of Lamb with Patatas a lo Pobre
description: Showstopping roast leg of lamb scented with garlic, lemon, thyme, oregano, and paprika, served over Spanish-style potatoes with onions and peppers. A slow, impressive family feast with Portuguese and Spanish touches.
prep_steps: Pat dry the leg of lamb.
Slice the onions and bell peppers.
Peel potatoes and slice into 5 mm rounds.
Mix marinade: olive oil, garlic, lemon zest and juice, paprika, oregano, thyme, salt, and black pepper.
Rub lamb all over with marinade; tuck in bay leaves and let sit 30–60 minutes at room temperature.
Preheat oven to 180°C (355°F). If using grill for searing, preheat OutdoorGrill to high.
cook_steps: Optional sear: Sear the marinated leg of lamb on the OutdoorGrill 2–3 minutes per side for color.
Set lamb on a rack over a roasting pan. Pour white wine into the pan.
Roast at 180°C for 75–100 minutes, until internal temp reaches 55–60°C for medium (adjust to preference). Baste once or twice with pan juices.
While lamb roasts, heat a large stovetop pan with a drizzle of olive oil. Add onions and bell peppers; cook 6–8 minutes until softened.
Add potato slices, season with salt, black pepper, and a pinch of paprika. Cook on medium, turning occasionally, 10–12 minutes until edges start to color.
Transfer potatoes, onions, and peppers to the roasting pan under the rack for the final 25–30 minutes so they absorb lamb juices. Stir once halfway.
Remove lamb to a board, tent with foil, and rest 15–20 minutes.
Toss potatoes with chopped parsley. Slice lamb thickly and serve over the potatoes with pan juices spooned on top.
